meanings.definition: Attribute (something) to a person or cause.
meanings.sent1: I impute my success to hard work and determination.
meanings.sent2: She imputed the error to a computer glitch.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how some people impute their bad luck to superstitions.
meanings.sent4: He always imputes his mood swings to the weather.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise imputed confidence in the student.

meanings.sent1: The court imputed the crime to the suspect.
meanings.sent2: She imputed the failure to poor planning.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how he tries to impute his mistakes to others.
meanings.sent4: The boss always imputes the success of the project to his leadership.
meanings.sent5: The detective imputed the theft to the cunning thief.

meanings.definition: Regard as belonging to or resulting from.
meanings.sent1: I impute this beautiful painting to the talented artist.
meanings.sent2: The team imputed the victory to their teamwork.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how some people impute their good luck to lucky charms.
meanings.sent4: She imputed her happiness to the peaceful surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The chef imputed the delicious taste to the secret ingredient.
